channel.title: small-variance-priors on James Uanhoro
channel.description: Recent content in small-variance-priors on James Uanhoro

item.title: The limitations of small variance priors lie in their implementation
item.description: Thanks to Muth√©n & Asparouhov (2012), hereafter MA2012,1 small variance priors are a common feature of Bayesian SEMs. The idea is: when we are not sure that a parameter is zero, you can place a prior that attempts to constrain the parameter to zero. A non-zero parameter will hopefully escape the constraint, while zero parameters will have most of their posterior concentrated around zero. Estimation of parameters constrained to zero In latent variable models, we assume relations between observed items are captured or mediated via the latent variables.
